title: HomeEscape Recent Article Details Tax-Deductions for Vacation Home Owners
text:
MIAMI, FL (8/14/2015) HomeEscape’s latest article details the ins and outs of tax-deductions for vacation rentals .
“Knowing how your property will be taxed is essential to creating a successful rental business,” remarked Avi Vaknin, CEO of HomeEscape.com. “Our analysts at HomeEscape are constantly compiling resources to help educate owners on the rental market,” Vaknin said.
A rental property can generate “taxable losses” that can be used to reduce your normal salary income, hence the federal income taxes you pay. Although one should never make real estate investment decisions solely on tax considerations, getting an understanding on the different elements of your personal tax situation can be extremely helpful.
“First you have to do your due diligence,” comments Vaknin. “Determine if your investment makes sense based on cash flows, cash on cash returns, renovation costs, rental income, financing, and the risk of any particular property – It is only appropriate to look at tax considerations once these issues are addressed.”
About HomeEscape: HomeEscape connects homeowners and property managers with travelers who seek the space, value and amenities of vacation rental homes as an alternative to hotels. With detailed property descriptions, photos and list of amenities and nearby attractions, HomeEscape makes it easy to find and compare properties all over the world.
